segment.source: 4945(S) A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.
segment.target: 4945(S) A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 4945(S) A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.
segment.target: Describes security event 4945(S) A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.

segment.source: 4945(S): A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.
segment.target: 4945(S): A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates every time Windows Firewall service starts.
segment.target: This event generates every time Windows Firewall service starts.

segment.source: This event shows the inbound and/or outbound rule which was listed when the Windows Firewall started and applied for “Public” profile.
segment.target: This event shows the inbound and/or outbound rule which was listed when the Windows Firewall started and applied for “Public” profile.

segment.source: This event generates per rule.
segment.target: This event generates per rule.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: None.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: None.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Profile used Type = UnicodeString: the name of the profile that the rule belongs to.
segment.target: Profile used Type = UnicodeString: the name of the profile that the rule belongs to.

segment.source: It always has value “Public”, because this event shows rules only for “Public” profile.
segment.target: It always has value “Public”, because this event shows rules only for “Public” profile.

segment.source: Rule:
segment.target: Rule:

segment.source: Rule ID Type = UnicodeString: the unique firewall rule identifier.
segment.target: Rule ID Type = UnicodeString: the unique firewall rule identifier.

segment.source: To see the unique ID of the rule you need to navigate to “HKEYLOCALMACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetServicesSharedAccessParametersFirewallPolicyFirewallRules” registry key and you will see the list of Windows Firewall rule IDs (Name column) with parameters:
segment.target: To see the unique ID of the rule you need to navigate to “HKEYLOCALMACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetServicesSharedAccessParametersFirewallPolicyFirewallRules” registry key and you will see the list of Windows Firewall rule IDs (Name column) with parameters:

segment.source: Rule Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the rule which was listed when the Windows Firewall started.
segment.target: Rule Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the rule which was listed when the Windows Firewall started.

segment.source: You can see the name of Windows Firewall rule using Windows Firewall with Advanced Security management console (wf.msc), check “Name” column:
segment.target: You can see the name of Windows Firewall rule using Windows Firewall with Advanced Security management console (wf.msc), check “Name” column:

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 4945(S): A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.
segment.target: For 4945(S): A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.

segment.source: Typically this event has an informational purpose.
segment.target: Typically this event has an informational purpose.

segment.source: Unfortunately this event shows rules only for Public profile, but you still can compare this list with your organization's Windows Firewall baseline for Public profile rules on different computers, and trigger an alert if the configuration is not the same.
segment.target: Unfortunately this event shows rules only for Public profile, but you still can compare this list with your organization's Windows Firewall baseline for Public profile rules on different computers, and trigger an alert if the configuration is not the same.
